Title: The Divergent Series: Allegiant Official Trailer – “The Truth Lies Beyond”
Comment:
Honestly I had watched all the Divergent films, they are very much fascinating and entertaining. This is why I decided reading the books (not to mention it were actually my first books to read.. coz honestly I'm not a reader). And I was so attached. Researching about it and end up watching every trailers of the trilogy and here I am very much of a disappointed that the books were not actually followed-- the story was changed. Just to mention, I am a short-termed-memory person and I actually believed the films was based on the book while reading it. I made myself believe that it were followed not until I watched the trailers (and I am planning rewatching the film tomorrow) it definitely were different stories with some of the book's plot. And of course it's disappointing. 

But as I have mentioned, I had watched the films first before I was ever able to read the books and as considering the film as a stand-alone, I'd say it were made with great creativity and skill, that made people love the characters

Title: The Divergent Series: Allegiant Official Trailer – “The Truth Lies Beyond”
Comment: Can everybody please stop hating on this movie. I've read the books, and i know it looks nothing like the book and there are a lot of differences from the book. But i mean, you cant turn a whole book into a movie without changing anything. And i know they made it more sci-fi and action than the book, but it actually follows the storyline of the book. And i understand why it is more sci-fi and action, because they want to attract more people than just divergent fans. It works different with movies than with books, becuase movies are living in a commercial world. Just because it isn't the same as the book doesn't mean it is rubbish. And because everybody went home after insurgent, becuase it was different from the book. Allegiant had a bad box office, what has lead to cut the budget of Ascendant and made it into a TV-series. And because of that decision Shai and Theo left the movie. AND THAT ALL BECAUSE IT WAS DIFFERENT FROM THE BOOKS???!!! Im so sorry for all the "fans" who are angry because the movies dont look like the books. But it is impossible to make a movie exactly the same as a book. I've read the books, and i love them. And i loved the movies too, because i'm a fan. So if you dont like the movies because they dont look like the book, back off and dont call yourself a fan. Because the REAL FANS who are waiting for Ascendant now are really dissapointed  because of the people who have just let the series down because they dont look like the book. So i really hope Lionsgate will change their plan for Ascendant because i cant wait to see the end of the series i love in theaters with Shai and Theo in it.

Title: The Divergent Series: Allegiant Official Trailer – “The Truth Lies Beyond”
Comment: In my opinion...Divergent the book sucks and i understand why it sells but honestly its not all that entertaining ,but was entertaining to its target audience which is mainly girls and the youth,it was popular with a lot of girls and kids aged 13 and under,it isn't all that great and but im not surprised how mainstream it got and the movies were worse,but enjoyable,im happy the movies at least got a trilogy though. What made me not like Divergent the most,is that we are seeing a trend of young women being protagonists in an action,romance,thriller series which as a guy tbh a times i find annoying and repetitive when that story is balls,but thats not the main problem and i think its amazing how women are getting main roles in action novels/movies and i love inclusivity of all races,genders and beliefs...but i can list soooo many of these movies it makes me hurl and dont get me wrong some of them are amazing for example twilight but the others are just fan service and love triangles and obvious mystery plots  and flawed main characters and also one sided writing and sexism...like tf,but the one book that comes to mind the quickest after reading the plot of the novel Divergent....the Hunger Games now this annoyed me that they were so similar tbh especially when the movie(Divergent) is like a wannabe Hunger Games which made it worse,dont get me wrong,the author of the book is great and this was an original idea,maybe if this came out before Hunger Games it would have received better a better book reception and movie ratings,in fact im almost positive it would,but the sad reality it was always being compared to the Hunger Games which is far better and also the reason why many people including me did not like the concept and story cause we feel it is repeating an idea(hunger games) and tweaking it,mainly i disliked Divergent because i mean come on it reminded me of Hunger Games and im(and everyone else) always comparing it to Hunger Games which had in my opinion a better main character,characters,book and story. The Hunger Games was fvcking amazing. My point being i felt that this book was like trying to be like Hunger Games and it was annoying,but it was still enjoyable. I  know this is very contradicting,like i found the book and movie enjoyable,but at the same time the story was flawed and also felt like a tweaked copy from another story,also the characers coulda been better,the only characters i liked was Beatrice and Wills characters from the original novel.

I liked this movie, i watched it first and then i read the book. Pretty easy to follow (for me). I liked it.

Another thing: I think we can all agree that Robert Schwenkte completely changed the storyline in the movie, and that's probably the main reason why Insurgent and Allegiant have such a low rating. Take a look at Divergent, directed by Neil Burger. If he would direct Insurgent and Allegiant, it would've a higher rating, because he would stay close to the books. Take a look at The Hunger games, the movies were close to the books, and that's a reason why the franchise is so popular. This also counts for Harry Potter.

Title: The Divergent Series: Allegiant Official Trailer – “The Truth Lies Beyond”
Comment:
Okay, I get that movie adaptions are supposed to be that, adaptions. And obviously, they've got to make changes. 
But they've put the entire Allegiant book into the entire first film. It's literally everything that happens, except from the obvious changes and ending. 

So, the second film is going to be completely made up, lol. There's nothing left they can do from the book, except from her death.

They've done it wrong, they rushed it. They should have shown Tris finding out the truth about the Bureau at the very end, instead of making up some rescue mission that never happens.
But if Veronica's okay with it, then we don't really have a choice. 
Oh well.

Title: The Divergent Series: Allegiant Official Trailer – “The Truth Lies Beyond”
Comment:
As much as I love this movies and the books of course, I have to admit this movie just sucks. I mean, it was REALLY BAD. There were too many ridiculous scenes. They just didn't show the war in Chicago, they put just a few scenes to explain this which makes Johanna and the rest of the "allegiants" remained totally wasted. And Jeff Daniels was totally wasted too. His character was just hilarious, kind of Eddie Redmayne in Jupiter Ascending.  
Everything in this movie that it could be interesting or good was totally wasted and poorly executed by the director. I'm feeling really disappointed right now and I still want my fucking money back. 
Do a favor yourselves and stay away from this crap, it doesn't worth.

Title: The Divergent Series: Allegiant Official Trailer – “The Truth Lies Beyond”
Comment:
Things I Have A Problem With:
1. Uriah's role still does not seem as prominent here as it was in the books
2. Who is the weapons specialist training Four? Is that Nita? Cara? Zoe? Either way, no.
3. Where's Matthew? Amar? George? TORI?! All important to the plot, none apparent in the trailer.

Things I Don't Have A Problem With:
1. The plot doesn't seem to follow the plot of the book at all, which I hated to begin with.
2. Emphasis on Tris being unique. They kinda glossed over that in the books, but it justifies her prominence with the Bureau outside of Chicago.
3. Technology. I'm not mad at it. If the Bureau can design all of these serums and things, why can't they make hovercrafts? Does Dystopian America have to lack technology? And there was mention of airplanes in Allegiant the book; why not just make them super fancy now?

Title: The Divergent Series: Allegiant Official Trailer – “The Truth Lies Beyond”
Comment: People keep complaining that the movie is nothing like the book, when the director and Roth both clearly stated that the movies and the book where going to remain separate. They would have to change a lot in the movie and add more action in order to keep the audience engaged. Also, many many people where disappointed with the ending of allegiant and the director and others have hinted that there will be major changes. In this trailer it shows the group going back to save the city after being told that it will soon be "erased". This doesn't happen in the book allegiant until the very end. Which means that allegiant (the movie) could possible cover points throughout the whole book and then go into completely new stuff the readers have never seen before with the 4th movie, ascendant. Tris is in ascendant so we know that she can't die in allegiant which supports the theory of her never actually dying.

Title: The Divergent Series: Allegiant Official Trailer – “The Truth Lies Beyond”
Comment:
WHAT. IS. THIS. MADNESS?! 

This is infuriating. You'd think that by how popular the books are, that you would get the slightest bit closer to the actual plot of the freaking book! But, nooooo! You had to make this garbage! What the bloody hell is this?!

First: Why over-exaggerate getting over the wall when in the first movie -- the one that was actually correct -- they stood on top of it like it was no problem?

Second: Those guys from the outside were not waiting behind a magical forcefield thingy that disappears. Tris and Four and everybody were walking on some train tracks when they met them.

Third (I promise I'm gonna stop on this one): If Chicago was such a secret and project, why would the children be allowed to see the surveillance footage! I get the adults that work with this stuff, but the kids? I mean, come on!

Title: The Divergent Series: Allegiant Official Trailer – “The Truth Lies Beyond”
Comment: I've never read the trilogy, which would probably explain why I enjoy the movies so much. In my opinion people should learn to appreciate all movie adaptions and not complain about any differences. After all, most movie producers work with the author themselves and discuss how the movie should go. If the author herself really had a complaint with how this movie went, she would've stood and said something. and trust me when I say, they would change the movie for her in a heartbeat, because it's her book and say she decided to go to social media and complain about something the movie producers wanted to do that she disagreed with. The fans would raise hell. All I see in this trailer is the author willing to make some changes to make the book more interesting. If she's happy with it, you all need to shut up and respect that.

Title: The Divergent Series: Allegiant Official Trailer – “The Truth Lies Beyond”
Comment:
Ok, I am just getting my opinion and ranting out-

Wow. Seriously? The setting looks nothing like the book...this is just a disappointment. There was no running across red deserts and the use of these sophisticated laser guns neither was there an invisible wall, which would only exist in a fantasy world....and this book is NOT supposed to be some fantasy world! It's supposed to display a normal world that we live in, none of this crazy ass, futuristic technology. There was no flying car thinys....there was trucks. And they drove in a truck to an abandoned railroad, NOT an invisible wall. The Bureau of Genetic Welfare isnt supposed to look like what everyone imagines a building in a future world would look like, its supposed to be a normal building that used to be an airport. They are ruining the simplicity of the book. Why are they trying to display the story in a futuristic world? Because it did not. Sure, the story is something that will most likely never ever happen to our world today, but that doesn't make it a futuristic story. Seriously? And, in the book, Tris didnt even know what tablet-like devices were, like the one that David gave to her to read her mother's journal and now its all about the technology and like she already knew all about it. And then the Part 2 name change to Ascendant? Like what the actual fuck??? Why cant they just do Allegiant Part 2? They are ruining the books by doing this. Its almost like they are disrespecting them, because the books are very well written and i respect them as super good books. In fact, so good that i have read the whole series over three times. I am obviously still going to see this, since im a hard core fangirl over it. I guess im just kinda disappointed because i love it too much and its almost like this movie may as well be separate from the book.....

Comment: I'm reading the book and it doesn't sound and/or look like the book. Now, I know the film is still going to be fantastic but still. What happened to Neil Burger who directed Divergent? He was great. Just to be clear for everyone who thinks they're not splitting it into two parts, they are. They just renamed them. Allegiant is Part 1 and Ascendant is Part 2. Don't believe me? Do research but hey, at least they're making money and at least we get two more Divergent films before the franchise is actually over. I know I was heartbroken when the end of The Hunger Games: Mockingjay Part 2 came, I was sad that the franchise was actually over so in a way, I'm super happy that they did spilt it into two parts because we can get more and tbh, Allegiant made a lot of sense and in my opinion, the best book out of all of the free, can't wait for the film!

Comment:
So I have a theory now why they changed the plot so much and the name of the last movie.
So after the ending of Allegiant (the book) many of the fans were disappointed because (SPOILER!!!!) tris sacrifices herself in the end for Caleb and dies. So I think the movie makers wanna give the fans the ending they hoped for and changed the plot in a way that tris will live.
I think the Allegiant movie will contain the whole third book, because in the trailer are too much things that happen in the end of the book (e.g. That Chicago will be erased, that comes out at the very end if the book). So that means that the fourth movie ascendents won't have anything to do with Allegiant and that's why they change the names and the movies slogan is the end is never what you expect because we all can't know the ending because it's an additional story/book.
I could be completely wrong but that's my theory on this whole movie fiasco.

So here's some advice..Read the book because you want to read it. Watch the movie to enjoy the damn action. Simple as that. If you watch a movie for it to be exactly word for word from a book, you need to pick up another hobby so you're not so damn bored.

"they must hav red teh rong book er something!1!1" 
Movie adaptations shouldn't be exactly like the book. Of course they shouldn't completely change the plot or characters, but they don't need to follow them completely. It's more interesting to go to a movie where you don't know what's going to happen rather than go to one where you know everything will be exactly the same as the book in my opinion. So stop whining and be happy you get adaptations. I'm only mad when they make characters look bad or change really important scenes, which it doesn't look like they're doing it here, but you can't judge a movie by its trailer.

Title: The Divergent Series: Allegiant Official Trailer – “The Truth Lies Beyond”
Comment: I read the full series of Divergent and was delighted and so excited for the movies. The first one was for the most part similar to the book, and i enjoyed watching it. Insurgent was less like the book, but I still saw it and didn't hate it, though I decided I would not watch it again. Looking from this trailer, I can tell it's going to go more downhill. This is nothing like the book. And don't tell me it is just because it has a VAGUELY similar plot and the same character names. In Insurgent, I didn't even know who Tris was. She was not the girl I read in the books. If you can't even figure out your characters, don't try to figure out the story. I will not be paying to see this movie, nor the next one. Such a disappointment.

Title: The Divergent Series: Allegiant Official Trailer – “The Truth Lies Beyond”
Comment:
Idk....this trailer is put together kind of poorly. On one end, you have the nice aspects of it; the visuals are on point, the casting looks alright overall, but on the other end there's some form of disconnect that i'm feeling as a viewer. My strongest negative feelings are toward the end, where they have that dramatic swell and it should be some intense trailer closer, but i'm just left with ......"that's it?". The movies have been ok, don't get me wrong, but that's the worst part: They're just eh. I hope the movie proves me wrong.

I haven't read the books at all, so all canon or lore is aside for me. It's just a film lover perspective.

Title: The Divergent Series: Allegiant Official Trailer – “The Truth Lies Beyond”
Comment:
MINOR ALLEGIANT SPOILERS.

I'm so excited for this movie! Yes, there are minor changes from the books, but all the main plot points are covered and there are small details they have included from the books. The Choosing Ceremony bowls, for example, are pictured at 0:10. The Bureau of Genetic Welfare is now shaped like a double helix because of their focus on DNA and genetics. The Bureau is also an airport, with futuristic pods, but there are also normal airplanes at one part in the trailer. Basically, the whole plot is there: Evelyn is trying to stop anyone from going over the wall, Tobias and Tris as well as a few others all venture over the wall. The things outside the wall may look like "Mars", but it actually looks like Allegiant's book cover. The Bureau has been watching Chicago and reveal their plan to erase it.
But let us not forget to be open to artistic interpretation. These are two different movies - what might work for a book might not for a movie.

I mean, Evelyn is still trying to prevent people from leaving, Tris, Four and the gang leave and go to the Bureau of Genetic Welfare, and we see the Bureau's plot against Chicago. In addition, we see other element, such as the Fringe and so on. Maybe I'm just optimistic.
